Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: How great is Your good that You have stored up [(in the world to come)] for those who fear You! [But] would that You wrought for those who take shelter in You against the sons of men [(in this world)]!

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Reuven shall live [in this world] and he shall not die [in the world to come (The episode of Bilhah (Genesis 352) will not be "brought up" to him)], and his men will be counted [among those of his brothers].

Version: William Davidson Edition - English
Content: and this action brings him to the life of the World-to-Come.

Ref: Ikar Tosafot Yom Tov on Pirkei Avot 4:5:7
Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: "from the world": The explanation [of this] is, from life in the world to come - Rambam.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: A psalm, a song [(sung by the Levites)] for the Sabbath day [(the world to come, which is all "Sabbath")].

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: "in the future to come": In the world to come.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: There is fortune and wealth in his house [(in this world)], and his righteousness endures forever [(in the world to come)].

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Blessed is the L-rd, the G-d of Israel, from the world [i.e., from this world] until the world [to come]." And all the people said "Amen" and [gave] praise to the L-rd.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Blessed is the L rd, the G d of Israel, from the world [i.e., from this world] until the world [to come]. And all the people will say Amen, Hallelukah!

Version: William Davidson Edition - English
Content: MISHNA: Anyone who performs one mitzva has goodness bestowed upon him, his life is lengthened, and he inherits the land, i.e., life in the World-to-Come. And anyone who does not perform one mitzva

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: In days to come shall Jacob take root, Israel shall blossom and bud; And the face of the world shall be filled with fruitage.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: "and He is destined to judge:" in the world to come.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: When you eat the toil of your hands, fortunate are you [(in this world)], and it is good unto you [(in the world to come)].

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Who is the man who desires life [in the world to come], who loves days [in this world] for the seeing of good [in the next] —

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: Rami bar Chama strongly objects to it, "And behold, a person can not cede something that has not come into the world! And even according to Rabbi Meir who says, 'A person can cede something that has

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: ...Rabbi Elazar says, Rav Avina says Anyone who says the verse of "Blessed is David" every day, three times , He is promised to merit the world to come.

Version: The Mishna with Obadiah Bartenura by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: He was wont to say: Better one hour for [purposes of] repentance and good deeds in this world than all of the life in the world to come. [For at that time repentance and good deeds are of no avail

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: Rabbi Yaakov says: This world is like a hallway before the world to come. Fix yourself in the hallway so you may enter the drawing room.

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: להיות עמה TO BE WITH HER, in the world to come (Gehinnom) (Genesis Rabbah 87:6).

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: חלילה לך IT IS UNWORTHY OF THEE —in the world to come.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: ...These are the ones who do not have a part in the world to come.

Version: The Mishna with Obadiah Bartenura by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: The generation of the flood have no share in the world to come and do not rise to be judged, viz. (Genesis 6:3): "My spirit will not judge in man forever" — neither judgment nor spirit, [i.e., they

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: Three kings and four commoners have no share in the World to Come. The three kings are: Jeroboam, Ahab, and Manasseh. Rabbi Yehudah says, Manasseh does have a share in the World to Come, as it says

Version: The Mishna with Obadiah Bartenura by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: All of Israel have a share in the world to come, viz. (Isaiah 60:12): "And your people, all righteous, forever shall inherit the land, the sprout of My plantings, the work of My hands, to be

Ref: Abraham Cohen Footnotes to the English Translation of Masechet Berakhot 28b:11
Version: Tractate Berakot by A. Cohen, Cambridge University Press, 1921
Content: To accompany him into the next world.
